image.altText: Crowd gathered around table

props.synopsis: Salmon farming is a controversial subject in Tasmania, and despite plans to place enclosures 12 kilometres offshore, opponents say it's still not good enough — no fish farming is welcome.

title.children: 'Under no circumstances': Offshore salmon farm trial unwelcome, opponents say

image.altText: Outline of stadium behind Hunter Street heritage buildings

props.synopsis: Opposition to the proposed Hobart stadium has been raised by the owner of Tasmania's two casinos, who says the structure will negatively "dominate" the waterfront precinct.

title.children: Gambling giant opposes Hobart stadium it says will 'dominate the landscape'

image.altText: Women playing cricket

props.synopsis: These women are enjoying learning to play cricket, but their club doesn't have adequate facilities for them.

title.children: These cricketers turn up in their gear 'or get dressed in the car'

image.altText: A singer sings on stage with an orchestra accompanying him

props.synopsis: When Palawa man Dewayne Everettsmith held his firstborn child, he wanted to soothe him by singing in the language of Tasmanian Aboriginal people. That desire has sparked an extraordinary musical journey with the Tasmanian Symphony Orchestra.

title.children: Dewayne's dream of singing to his baby in palawa kani inspires orchestral project

image.altText: Head and shoulder image of a young man smiling.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian father who lost his son to an incurable brain tumour reflects on a moving letter from former Liverpool footballer Adam Lallana.

title.children: 21yo man's dying wish for his father fulfilled by English football player

image.altText: A group of protesters in Hostage Square holding pictures of Edan, a young man.

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old is expected to be reunited with his family at the Israeli border, after 580 days in captivity.

title.children: Israeli-American hostage Edan Alexander released by Hamas

image.altText: Sussan Ley, David Littleproud, Angus Taylor, Peter Dutton QT 20221027_041653670_iOS

props.synopsis: Nationals leader David Littleproud has signalled commitments to net zero, like all Coalition policies, are up for debate, prompting some Liberals to question the immediate future of the partnership in opposition.

title.children: Liberal leadership race goes down to the wire as Nats weigh net zero

image.altText: anthony albanese points towards reporters outside parliament house in canberra

props.synopsis: The reshuffle announced by Anthony Albanese is a mix of continuity and change, with those in the government's top rank staying in their previous ministries.

title.children: Albanese shifts Plibersek from environment in favour of 'can-do' Watt

image.altText: A man walks past two terrace houses

props.synopsis: Inflation is declining and global growth is under a cloud but feeding rate cuts into an already hot property market is likely to spark another buying frenzy and even higher prices. That could throw doubt on the RBA's ability to provide the number of cuts pencilled in for this year.

title.children: Why the Reserve Bank is wary of rocketing real estate prices

image.altText: A woman in a yellow

props.synopsis: For Vietnam, one of the world's most export-reliant economies, the stakes of its negotiations with US President Donald Trump on the future of his tariffs plan could not be higher.

title.children: 'A lot of us here are worried': The far-reaching impact of Trump's tariffs

image.altText: A woman rushing in a hospital corridor.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into the $2 billion residential care system finds children in three of the biggest states are being preyed upon by child sex abusers when they should be safe in state care.

title.children: Girl in 24/7 care 'so far gone' she may die from sexual exploitation

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: The meeting between the Ukrainian and Russian presidents was first proposed by Volodymyr Zelenskyy, but has still not drawn a response from the Kremlin.

title.children: Donald Trump floats ‘possibility’ of joining Zelenskyy-Putin peace talks

image.altText: Donald Trump holds a list of tariffs by country.

props.synopsis: The US president says he could speak to China's President Xi Jinping by the end of the week, after the two countries agreed to a 90-day pause on reciprocal tariffs.

title.children: Trump claims 'reset' with China following tariff agreement

image.altText: A drawing of Sean Combs, wearing a pale blue jumper, making a heart sign with his hands while standing in court.

props.synopsis: The prosecution argues Sean "Diddy" Combs used his power to coerce victims into marathon drug-fuelled orgies, while the defence says its client is merely a "swinger" with unconventional sexual proclivities.

title.children: Prosecutors lay out case against Diddy as music mogul's trial begins

image.altText: A man with white hair and white beard wearing frameless glasses looks sternly away from the camera

props.synopsis: In a national address, Narendra Modi also vowed to take retaliatory action for any future terror attacks.

title.children: India has only 'paused' military action against Pakistan, Modi says

image.altText: Ed Husic

props.synopsis: Ed Husic says dumping attorney-general Mark Dreyfus was "gratuitous" and denied him dignity, in a new swipe at his party's factional frontbench carve-up.

title.children: 'It was just gratuitous': Ed Husic's swipe at Labor's reshuffle

image.altText: A smiling woman with short, blonde hair stands outside. She wears a brightly-coloured suit.

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party has retained the seat of Monash, according to ABC chief elections analyst Antony Green.

title.children: Liberal Party predicted to retain Victorian seat of Monash

image.altText: a woman holds a us flag

props.synopsis: The first group of 49 white South Africans to be granted refugee status by the Trump administration have been flown to the US.

title.children: First group of white South Africans fly to US under Trump refugee plan

image.altText: A woman standing next to a teen boy at his school graduation

props.synopsis: There are concerns many young people with fetal alcohol spectrum disorder in Australia are falling through the cracks because of a lack of diagnostic and support services.

title.children: Australia's first fetal alcohol spectrum disorder clinical guidelines released

image.altText: Large packets of a light brown powdery substance with red labels on top, stacked on a table.

props.synopsis: Kava smuggling into the Northern Territory's remote Indigenous communities is on the rise, with local leaders fearing the black market price of the drink is draining family finances and fuelling social problems.

title.children: Smuggled kava is smashing family finances in the remote NT, leaders say

image.altText: Crowd gathered around table

props.synopsis: Salmon farming is controversial in Tasmania, and despite plans to place enclosures 12 kilometres offshore, opponents say it's still not good enough — no fish farming is welcome.

title.children: 'Under no circumstances': Offshore salmon farm trial unwelcome, opponents say

image.altText: A drone shot of a large blaze burning through the roof of a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: Russia has targeted the European nation with sabotage, cyberattacks and disinformation due to its support for Ukraine, the Polish government says.

title.children: Poland to shut Russian consulate after Warsaw arson attack

image.altText: the pope smiles in front of a beige background.

props.synopsis: Pope Leo XIV called for the media to "disarm" itself of prejudice and hatred in his first address to reporters.

title.children: Pope warns reporters against using words to fan 'hatred' in first media address

image.altText: A man and woman stand in front of a for-sale sign, which has a large sold sticker plastered across it.

props.synopsis: Victoria lost over 24,000 rentals last year — or 3.6 per cent of the state's entire rental stock — as an investor sell-off gained pace.

title.children: Victoria loses 24,000 rentals in a year as investors flee market

image.altText: A man in a navy blue suit, white shirt and blue tie with short grey hair smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Downing Street thanked emergency services for tackling the fire, which took hold in the early hours of the morning.

title.children: Police investigate fire at UK prime minister's London home

image.altText: Two flags on flagpoles, one is for the Solomon Islands, the other is China's.

props.synopsis: China's embassy in the Solomon Islands becomes embroiled in a foreign interference controversy after allegedly forcing a newly appointed minister in the Pacific island nation to quit an international group.

title.children: Claims Beijing issued 'shocking challenge' to Solomon Islands sovereignty

image.altText: Noah lolesio carried on a stretcher after being injured against the Western Force.

props.synopsis: Depth is a major concern for the Wallabies, meaning they cannot afford to lose players to injury in the build-up to the British and Irish Lions tour.

title.children: Wallabies reminded injury is a curse ahead of Lions series

image.altText: A person stands taking a photo of their friend next to a medieval fantasy knight.

props.synopsis: Warcraft has been uniting people across the globe for 30 years. This Adelaide man went from watching his dad play on their home computer, to designing the games himself.

title.children: Darren used to watch his dad play Warcraft, now he's designing the games

image.altText: ukrainelandmines

props.synopsis: The ABC has confirmed Nick Parsons died last week while working for a non-government organisation that clears landmines.

title.children: Australian bomb disposal worker killed in Ukraine

image.altText: Thumbnail Pakistan missile

props.synopsis: Fighting between Pakistan and India flared up over the weekend in a continuation of decades of hostility between the neighbouring countries.

title.children: What the fighting between India and Pakistan is about

image.altText: A high-angle shot of a white woman with grey hair, in a blue patterned dress. She has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Women living with HIV are calling for an increase in HIV testing for women and that more funding be directed to programs in regional Australia that provide support to women with the virus.

title.children: Why so many women are diagnosed late with HIV

image.altText: Virat Kohli with a worried expression

props.synopsis: Legendary Indian batter Virat Kohli announces his retirement from Test cricket, finishing his career in the longest format on the eve of his side's series in England.

title.children: Indian legend Virat Kohli announces retirement from Test cricket

image.altText: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively walking holding hands on a street

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift's subpoena in the It Ends With Us case is another attempt "to intimidate and attack women's rights and reputations," Lively's spokesperson said.

title.children: Swift spokesperson claims subpoena in Lively-Baldoni case is 'tabloid clickbait'

image.altText: A man sits in a chair on a stage. He wears a brown suit and a hat with wires connected to it.

props.synopsis: Can we continue a creative life after death — and should we? They're questions you'll come face-to-face with as you walk past the "brain in a jar" at the Art Gallery of Western Australia.

title.children: 'Brain in a jar' gives musician life beyond death

image.altText: A black and white image of a nursey full of babies, with a blue cross above one baby's head and the word "Elizabeth".

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Wray and Rohan Samara are two of the thousands of children evacuated from Vietnam at the fall of Saigon 50 years ago as part of Operation Babylift. They're embarking on a quest to find their biological families.

title.children: Liz and Rohan arrived in Australia in boxes. They're looking for their families
